newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil mum on report of $5.5 bln'96 trade deficit.
newsitem.headline: Brazil mum on report of $5.5 bln'96 trade deficit.

text.p: Brazilian officials declined to comment Monday on a weekend newspaper report that put the 1996 trade deficit at a little over $5.5 billion after a record monthly trade gap of $1.787 billion in December.
"I cannot deny or confirm that," said a Ministry of Industry and Commerce spokeswoman.
Government sources, requesting anonymity, said the figures seemed correct but could not definitely confirm them.
Jornal do Brasil reported Saturday that imports last year totalled $53.287 billion. Exports have already been announced at $47.7 billion.
